The photos were published in a Facebook: 2020, and have been shared more than 240 times.
The misleading post contains a Hindi: language caption that translates to English, claiming that Muslims have captured a space of 50 yards at the Old Delhi Railway Station for offering Islamic prayer.
Munindra Kumar Chaudhary: the Acting Superintendent of the Old Delhi Railway Station, refuted the claim as "baseless" and stated that there is no designated space for any religious ritual inside the station premises.
